slips.advice: Praise yourself everyday. What positive small things did you accomplish today?
If you've decided to create a project for your portfolio, just do it well enough. It doesn't have to be perfect.
Allow yourself to study the way you will enjoy - whether it's listening to a lecture, reading, or working on a project. The key is to keep moving forward on your journey.
You are smart enough. If there's something you don't grasp immediately, trust that understanding will come with time.
Be patient. Don't demand from yourself quick results. Becoming a programmer may take 6 months for some and 2 years for others. Everyone's journey is unique and that's ok
If you feel weary, remind yourself: 'I am a successful person and doing what I enjoy.'
View everything as a victory. Treat failures as valuable experiences.
Just get ready to do something. Open your computer and have a notebook ready for writing. This will help to start.
Create simple projects for your portfolio. The more you make, the more you'll learn.
Surround yourself with positive individuals and those you can seek advice fromâ€”people you aspire to be like.
